Parameters:

checkDestinationCards

checkHand

public void checkHand(Route r1)
This method checks all the possibilites that a player has for claiming a route depending on the cards in the players hand. It presents the player with every option possible depending on the route chosen.

Parameters:
r1 - the route that is to be checked

checkRoute

public int checkRoute(City begin,
                      City end)
Checks the route to see if it's a double route or single route

Parameters:
begin - the first city
end - the second city
Returns:
2 if its a double, 1 if its a single and 0 if there isn't a route

checkTopFive

public boolean checkTopFive()
Checks the top five cards to make sure there is not more than three Locomotive cards.

Returns:
true if there are more than three and false otherwise.

dealFirstDest

public void dealFirstDest()
Gives players the initial destination tickets to pick from.

dealThreeDests

public void dealThreeDests()
Gives the user three destination cards to choose from. The user must select at least one. All unselected cards are put on bottom of destination deck.

declareLongestRoute

public void declareLongestRoute()

Called by the browser or applet viewer to inform this JApplet that it is being reclaimed and that it should destroy any resources that it has allocated. The stop method will always be called before destroy.

Returns parameter information about this JApplet. Returns information about the parameters than are understood by this JApplet. Each element of the array should be a set of three Strings containing the name, the type, and a description.

public void start()
Called by the browser or applet viewer to inform this JApplet that it should start its execution. It is called after the init method and each time the JApplet is revisited in a Web page.

stop

public void stop()
Called by the browser or applet viewer to inform this JApplet that it should stop its execution. It is called when the Web page that contains this JApplet has been replaced by another page, and also just before the JApplet is to be destroyed.

Overrides:
stop in class java.applet.Applet

trainClicked

public int trainClicked(int xVal,
                        int yVal)
Checks to see which of the five draw cards was chosen

Parameters:
xVal - the x value of the clicked position
yVal - the y value of the clicked position
Returns:
0-5 depending on which card was chosen or -1 if there wasn't a card clicked
